intro: Staebe aethiopica, commonly known as the Ethiopian stave, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. It typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in cooler, high-altitude environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
